Sequence Information.Peptide Name: ASP-1 (anti-staphylococcal peptide; natural AMPs; lactone; depsipeptide, bacteriocins; Gram-positive bacteria, prokaryotes; XXE; XXJ, UCSB1b)

Literature Information.Literature: APD analysis reveals that the sequence of this peptide shows 42% similarity toFusaricidin D. An alternative for the last residue is Leu. The N-terminus is acetylated and dehydrated threonine is proposed to form an ester bond with the C-terminal carboxyl group.Activity: Active against S. aureus NCIM 2901, 5021, and 2127 strains (MIC 2-16 ug/ml), including most MRSA strains (MIC 8-64, but can also be 512 ug/ml).  Updated 7/2021
Literature Information.Author: Chalasani AG, Roy U, Nema S.2017
Literature Information.Reference: Int J Antimicrob Agents. 2017 Sep 5. pii: S0924-8579(17)30329-1. doi: 10.1016/j.ijantimicag.2017.08.030.PubMed
Literature Information.Title: Purification and characterization of a novel anti-staphylococcal peptide (ASP-1) from bacillus sp. URID 12.1.
